node.title: Family or freedom: Australia leaves Afghan interpreters with impossible choice
node.description: Hundreds of former interpreters remain in hiding across Afghanistan,Â but escape to Australia still comes with a cost.
node.content:
["Former Afghan interpreters are being forced to make an impossible decision, to leave their families behind, or risk losing the chance at a new life in Australia.\u00a0", "Ahmid* flew to Australia from the Pakistani capital, Islamabad last Thursday, leaving behind his wife and five children under the age of 10. The Drum spoke to him from hotel quarantine in Sydney.", "\"They are crying and I am also very unhappy. I lost my hope (sic), this is a very difficult time.\"", "Ahmid served with the Australian Defence Force in Uruzgan between 2010 and 2011.", "As the Taliban advanced across Afghanistan in July and August, many former ADF interpreters, who were already identified as being eligible for a visa under the so-called Locally Engaged Employee (or LEE) program, were issued with emergency 449 visas to facilitate their evacuation. The Drum understands that the vast majority of visas included the names of wives and children.", "But in the chaos of the withdrawal in late August, after the Taliban had taken the capital Kabul, Home Affairs asked Australian consulates in other countries to assist in issuing 449 visas.\u00a0", "", "
Emails like these included names of the interpreters themselves\u00a0but missed those of their immediate families.(Supplied.\u00a0)
", "Ahmid is one of an unknown number of interpreters whose visas were issued by Australian immigration officials in Jakarta, Nairobi and China.\u00a0", "Ahmid received his visa notification from Australian immigration in China on August 25. It advised that he \"and any immediate family members with Australian visas you have already identified to us, should go to the airport\".\u00a0", "But it included a devastating omission, listing only the primary applicant \u2014\u00a0his name \u2014\u00a0and not his family. This is despite Ahmid previously listing the names of his wife and children in certification documents supplied to Defence.\u00a0", "", "
Ahmid* was shot by a guard while trying to access an evacuation flight with his family.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "Regardless, the visa came too late. Ahmid was already in hospital recovering from a gunshot wound, after allegedly being shot in the leg by a Taliban guard while attempting to enter Kabul International Airport.\u00a0", "Australia's last evacuation flight departed the day after his visa was issued, just hours before suicide bombers targeted the airport's perimeter, killing at least 183 people.\u00a0", "
Family names missing from visas issued by Australian consulates\u00a0
", "Jason Scanes, the founder and director of Forsaken Fighters, an Australian-based NGO that\u00a0assists former interpreters, has been in almost constant contact with Ahmid and around 180 other former interpreters who have been issued with 449 visas.", "He believes the names of family members left off their visas because of a lack of communication between Home Affairs and Australian consular staff.\u00a0", "\"These men presented as family units and they've already been identified as such by Defence, I don't understand how they could have been left off,\" he said.", "Mr Scanes says only a handful of interpreters were evacuated before Australia's rescue mission ended. He questions decisions that were made at the time, which saw more high-profile evacuees airlifted from the stricken nation.\u00a0", "The advice to 449 visa holders left behind in Afghanistan was to remain at home\u00a0and await further instructions.", "But in the intervening months, the situation for many has become increasingly intolerable, with the Taliban moving from house to house, targeting and killing former Afghan National Army soldiers and people who assisted coalition forces. At least one former ADF interpreter is known to have been murdered.\u00a0", "A looming deadline only added to their worries, with the 449 visas scheduled to expire three months after they were issued.", "Fearful that they would miss out completely, Ahmid decided\u00a0to flee by land to Pakistan with his wife and five children in early November. But the Australian High Commission in Islamabad refused to process his family because they weren't listed on Ahmid's initial 449 visa issued by the Australian consulate in China.", "Then last week, just days before they lapsed, Home Affairs announced it would extend the 449 visas for another 12 months.", "", "
Former Australian Army captain\u00a0Jason Scanes\u00a0has been advocating for the safe evacuation of interpreters and their families for some time.\u00a0(Four Corners)
", "Mr Scanes said\u00a0the government was finally moving to hasten evacuations after months of little or no contact with interpreters.\u00a0", "\"They were forced to make the desperate dash to get to Pakistan because they believed that their visas were going to expire\", he said.", "\"It's been an absolute stuff-up of bureaucracy \u2026 it really contradicts what the government is saying is their priority, which is women and children.\"", "
An awful choice\u00a0
", "Jamie*, another former interpreter, also made the treacherous journey to Pakistan, with his wife and one-month-old baby daughter.", "", "
Jamie* could be killed if he stays in Afghanistan\u00a0but coming to Australia means leaving his wife and baby behind.\u00a0(Supplied.)
", "He completed his biometric testing at the Australian High Commission in Islamabad last Friday.\u00a0", "He has\u00a0been told that his wife and baby will not\u00a0be travelling with him, because, like Ahmid, neither of them were listed on his visa.", "They've since returned to Afghanistan\u00a0but Jamie says he has no option but to continue his journey to Australia.\u00a0", "\"All in my area they know I have worked [for]\u00a0and supported the coalition forces and ADF\", he said.\u00a0", "\"They [the Taliban] can do anything and they are currently killing people.\"\u00a0", "
Hunted by the Taliban
", "Meanwhile, hundreds of other interpreters remain in hiding in Afghanistan, having heeded the government's advice to stay put.\u00a0", "Zaland* is among them. His LEE visa was issued in August, granting him and any family members the right to stay in Australia permanently, and seek citizenship.\u00a0", "Zaland waited two-and-a-half years for this privilege, during which time he married. By the time his visa was issued his wife was heavily pregnant with their first child.\u00a0", "But he hadn't updated his application to include his growing family\u00a0and was unable to convince authorities to let them board an evacuation flight in August.\u00a0", "Zaland's wife delivered a baby girl in Kabul on October 17th.\u00a0", "", "
Zaland's* baby girl in hospital.\u00a0She died in the weeks following this photo.\u00a0(Supplied.)
", "\"I don't have a salary at the moment, so I had no money to pay for my wife and daughter's treatment,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"I had to take them to a government hospital, where they had no oxygen and no medicines.\"", "Zaland's baby died in hospital eight days later.\u00a0", "Last Friday, he finally received a call from Home Affairs advising him that he and his wife will be prioritised for a flight to Australia. No date has been given for their departure.\u00a0", "Like many, Zaland has been forced to move from house to house to avoid detection by the Taliban.\u00a0", "\"We stayed at my father's for a little while, and then my uncle's, but he said it wasn't safe,\" he said.\u00a0", "Days after Kabul had fallen to the Taliban in mid-August, the Australian government announced that 3,000 places would be offered exclusively to Afghan nationals under its 2021 humanitarian program.\u00a0", "According to Home Affairs, this allocation is separate from\u00a0Afghans who have come to Australia on 449 visas.\u00a0", "But last week a Senate inquiry heard that not one of these humanitarian visas has been issued, despite the government receiving more than 26,000 applications.\u00a0", "", "
Prime Minister Scott Morrison says helping the people of Afghanistan remains a high priority for his government.(ABC News: Tamara Penniket)
", "Today, the Prime Minister reiterated his government's commitment to helping the people of Afghanistan.\u00a0", "\"It is our highest priority in the refugee and humanitarian program \u2026 we are all working together on what is a very challenging issue,\" he said.", "In a statement, the Department of Home Affairs said it does not discuss individual cases but that they are aware that a number of Afghans on temporary 449 visas have left Afghanistan via land borders\u00a0and the government would provide assistance for them where possible.", "*Names have been changed to protect identities.", "The Drum airs weeknights on ABC and News Channel."]
